name: Limit SOP
description: The Limit SOP creates geometry from samples fed to it by CHOPs. It creates geometry at every point in the sample. Different types of geometry can be created using the Output Type parameter on the Channels Page.
summary: The Limit SOP creates geometry from samples fed to it by CHOPs. It creates geometry at every point in the sample. Different types of geometry can be created using the Output Type parameter on the Chan

parameters.name: CHOP
parameters.label: CHOP
parameters.description:
From Derivative
		
		
		
		
		Jump to navigation
		Jump to search
		
The Limit  creates geometry from samples fed to it by CHOPs. It creates geometry at every point in the sample. Different types of geometry can be created using the Output Type parameter on the Channels Page.
limitSOP_Class

Contents
 
 
 
 
 
 
 





  chop - Specifies which  Network /  contains the sample data to fetch.



  rord -  - Specifies the order in which the Rotate Channel X / Y / Z channels are applied.

 xyz - xzy - yxz - yzx - zxy - zyx -

  chanx - Channels used to specify the point's positions, tx.



  chany - Channels used to specify the point's positions, ty.



  chanz - Channels used to specify the point's positions, tz.



  chanrx - Channels used to specify the rotational data of the geomtery created at each point. Only used when Output Type is " at Each " or " Circle at Each ".



  chanry - Channels used to specify the rotational data of the geomtery created at each point. Only used when Output Type is " at Each " or " Circle at Each ".



  chanrz - Channels used to specify the rotational data of the geomtery created at each point. Only used when Output Type is " at Each " or " Circle at Each ".



  chanrad - Uniformly controls the radius of the geometry created at each point. The Radius channels are multiplied with the Radius parameter on the Output Page.



  chanradx - Channels that control the radius on the respective axis. The Radius channels are multiplied with the Radius parameter on the Output Page.



  chanrady - Channels that control the radius on the respective axis. The Radius channels are multiplied with the Radius parameter on the Output Page.



  chanradz - Channels that control the radius on the respective axis. The Radius channels are multiplied with the Radius parameter on the Output Page.



  chanalpha - Controls the point alpha, giving you alpha control of any geometry created at those points.	
Note: If using a Copy SOP, turn on the Use Template   option in the Copy 's  Page to allow the geometry to inherit the point attributes.



  chanr - These channels control the point color, or the color of any geometry created at those points.



  chang - These channels control the point color, or the color of any geometry created at those points.



  chanb - These channels control the point color, or the color of any geometry created at those points.



  texturew - Controls the w texture-offset for the point(s) This is most often used as a frame-offset or time-offset, expressed in # of frames from the current frame or frame 1 of an image sequence.





Allows custom attributes to be added to the geometry created. Use the + button to add additional parameters to add more custom attributes.

  customattr - Sequence of custom attributes to be added to the geometry created.



  customattr0name - Specify the name of the custom attribute, for example pscale, age, or any custom name.



  customattr0chan0 - Select which channel to assign to the [0] index of the attribute. ie. pscale[0]



  customattr0chan1 - Select which channel to assign to the [1] index of the attribute. ie. pscale[1]



  customattr0chan2 - Select which channel to assign to the [2] index of the attribute. ie. pscale[2]



  customattr0chan3 - Select which channel to assign to the [3] index of the attribute. ie. pscale[3]






  output -  - The type of geometry the Limit  produces from its sample data.

 line - Creates a point for each sample and connects them with a polygonal line. polys - Places a polygon at each sample point. Number of points in polygon defined by Divisions. circles - Places a primitive circle at each sample point. spheres - Places a primitive sphere at each smaple point. polyspheres - Places a polygonal sphere at each sample point. Sphere's frequency defined by Divisions. tubes - Creates a tube down the path. Tubes cross-section defined by Divisions. strips - Creates a strip down the path. Number of points in strip defined by Divisions.

  divisions - Only works on the following Output Types.	
 at Each  - Number of points per polygon.
Poly Sphere at Each  - Frequency of each Polygonal Sphere.
Tubes - Number of points in cross-section of the tube.
Strips - Number of points in cross-section of the strip.


  rad - Radius of geometry created. Disabled for "Polygonal Line".



  flipsmooth - Dynamically controls the twist of each instance of geometry on a series of points to avoid frame-by-frame flipping, which can sometimes occur when geometry is oriented along a path.



  dolimit -  - Creates a bounding box for the position of the output geometry. Drop down menu determines behavior when outside bounded region.

 off - Bounding region off. clamp - Clamps position to specified value. loop - Loops position between bounded region. zigzag - Zigzags position back and forth between bounded region.

  xlimit -  - Parameters to set edges of bounding region when Limit is active.

xlimitmin -xlimitmax -

  ylimit -  - Parameters to set edges of bounding region when Limit is active.

ylimitmin -ylimitmax -

  zlimit -  - Parameters to set edges of bounding region when Limit is active.

zlimitmin -zlimitmax -

  texture - Applys u, v, and w texture coordinates to the created geometry.



  texscale -  - Scales the texture coordinates a specific amount.

texscale1 -texscale2 -

  texoffset -  - Offsets the texture coordinates a specific amount.

texoffset1 -texoffset2 -

  orient - If this option is selected, the object will be oriented along the path. To see what the path looks like, change the Output Type to "Polygonal Line". When the Output Type is "/ Circle at Each ", the positive Z axis of each object will be pointing down the path. When the Output Type is "Tubes/Strips" then the cross-section of the geometry created will be pointing down the path.



  lookat - Orient to  must be checked for Lookat Object to have any effect. This allows you to orient your geometry by naming the object you would like it to Look At, or point to. Once you have designated this object to look at, it will continue to face that object, even if you move it. The Look At parameter points the each piece of geometry at the other object's origin individually.



  dorotate -  - Rotate the geometry at each point using the Rotate parameter (below). Only works for Output Type is "/ Circle at Each ".

 off - Do not rotate polys. Rotate parameter is greyed out. on - Add value of Rotate to polys equally. cum - Add value of Rotate to polys cumulatively (ie. increasing with each poly).

  rotate -  - Rotation channels rx, ry, and rz for Rotate Polys parameter.

 rotatex - rotatey - rotatez -

  normals - Computes normals for the geometry created.





Extra Information for the Limit  can be accessed via an Info CHOP.



 - Number of points in this . - Number of primitives in this . - Number of particles in this . - Time spent in another thread updating geometry data on the  from the 's CPU data. As it is part of another thread, this time is not part of the usual frame time. - Time spent in another thread updating meta surface geometry data (such as metaballs or nurbs) on the  from the 's CPU data. As it is part of another thread, this time is not part of the usual frame time.
 - Number of times the operator has cooked since the process started. - Duration of the last cook in milliseconds. - Frame number when this operator was last cooked relative to the component timeline. - Frame number when this operator was last cooked relative to the absolute time. - Time in milliseconds at which the operator started cooking in the frame it was cooked. - Time in milliseconds at which the operator finished cooking in the frame it was cooked. - 1 if operator was cooked this frame. - Number of warnings in this operator if any. - Number of errors in this operator if any.
TouchDesigner Build: Latest\nwikieditorwikieditorwikieditor2021.100002020.200002018.28070before 2018.28070
SOPs
• • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • 

A Operator Family that reads, creates and modifies 3D points, polygons, lines, particles, surfaces, spheres and meatballs. Particles and point clouds are now done primarily on the GPU using TOPs.



An Operator Family which operate on Channels (a sequence of numbers (Samples)) which are used for animation, audio, mathematics, simulation, logic, UI construction, and data streamed from/to devices and protocols.



A CHOP outputs one or more channels, where a channel is simply a sequence of numbers (Samples), representing motion, audio, etc. Channels are passed between CHOPs in TouchDesigner networks. Channels can be Exported to Parameters.



A polygon is a type of Primitive that is formed from a set of Vertices in 3D that are implicitly connected together to form a multi-edge shape.



Each SOP has a list of Points. Each point has an XYZ 3D position value plus other optional attributes. Each polygon Primitive is defined by a vertex list, which is list of point numbers.



A surface type in SOPs that includes polygon, curve (NURBS and Bezier), patch (NURBS and Bezier) and other basic shapes like sphere, tube and metaball. Points and Primitives are part of the Geometry Detail, which is a part of a SOP.



Information associated with SOP geometry. Points and primitives (polygons, NURBS, etc.) can have any number of attributes - position (P) is standard, and built-in optional attributes are normals (N), texture coordinates (uv), color (Cd), etc.



The location of an operator within the TouchDesigner environment, for example, /geo1/circle1, a node called circle1 in a component called geo1. The path / is called Root. This path is displayed at the top of every Pane, showing which Component's network you are currently in. To refer instead to a filesystem folder, directory, disk file or http: address, see Folder.



The sub-Family of Component types that are used to define and render 3D scenes. A Geometry Component is an Object that contains the 3D shapes to render. A Camera COMP and Light COMP are other Object types. Separately, "Objects" also refers to Python objects.



The Graphics Processing Unit. This is the high-speed, many-core processor of the graphics card/chip that takes geometry, images and data from the CPU and creates images and processed data.








Retrieved from "https://docs.derivative.ca/index.php?title=Limit_SOP&oldid=32299"
		Category: SOPs

An Operator Family which operate on Channels (a sequence of numbers (Samples)) which are used for animation, audio, mathematics, simulation, logic, UI construction, and data streamed from/to devices and protocols.



A CHOP outputs one or more channels, where a channel is simply a sequence of numbers (Samples), representing motion, audio, etc. Channels are passed between CHOPs in TouchDesigner networks. Channels can be Exported to Parameters.



A polygon is a type of Primitive that is formed from a set of Vertices in 3D that are implicitly connected together to form a multi-edge shape.



Each SOP has a list of Points. Each point has an XYZ 3D position value plus other optional attributes. Each polygon Primitive is defined by a vertex list, which is list of point numbers.



A surface type in SOPs that includes polygon, curve (NURBS and Bezier), patch (NURBS and Bezier) and other basic shapes like sphere, tube and metaball. Points and Primitives are part of the Geometry Detail, which is a part of a SOP.



Information associated with SOP geometry. Points and primitives (polygons, NURBS, etc.) can have any number of attributes - position (P) is standard, and built-in optional attributes are normals (N), texture coordinates (uv), color (Cd), etc.



The location of an operator within the TouchDesigner environment, for example, /geo1/circle1, a node called circle1 in a component called geo1. The path / is called Root. This path is displayed at the top of every Pane, showing which Component's network you are currently in. To refer instead to a filesystem folder, directory, disk file or http: address, see Folder.



The sub-Family of Component types that are used to define and render 3D scenes. A Geometry Component is an Object that contains the 3D shapes to render. A Camera COMP and Light COMP are other Object types. Separately, "Objects" also refers to Python objects.



The Graphics Processing Unit. This is the high-speed, many-core processor of the graphics card/chip that takes geometry, images and data from the CPU and creates images and processed data.








Retrieved from "https://docs.derivative.ca/index.php?title=Limit_SOP&oldid=32299"

parameters.name: CHOP
parameters.label: CHOP
parameters.description: chop - Specifies which  Network /  contains the sample data to fetch.

parameters.name: Rotate Order
parameters.label: Rotate Order
parameters.description:
rord -  - Specifies the order in which the Rotate Channel X / Y / Z channels are applied.

 xyz - xzy - yxz - yzx - zxy - zyx -

parameters.name: Rx Ry Rz
parameters.label: Rx Ry Rz
parameters.description: xyz - xzy - yxz - yzx - zxy - zyx -

parameters.name: X Channel
parameters.label: X Channel
parameters.description: chanx - Channels used to specify the point's positions, tx.

parameters.name: Y Channel
parameters.label: Y Channel
parameters.description: chany - Channels used to specify the point's positions, ty.

parameters.name: Z Channel
parameters.label: Z Channel
parameters.description: chanz - Channels used to specify the point's positions, tz.

parameters.name: Rotate Channel X
parameters.label: Rotate Channel X
parameters.description: chanrx - Channels used to specify the rotational data of the geomtery created at each point. Only used when Output Type is " at Each " or " Circle at Each ".

parameters.name: Rotate Channel Y
parameters.label: Rotate Channel Y
parameters.description: chanry - Channels used to specify the rotational data of the geomtery created at each point. Only used when Output Type is " at Each " or " Circle at Each ".

parameters.name: Rotate Channel Z
parameters.label: Rotate Channel Z
parameters.description: chanrz - Channels used to specify the rotational data of the geomtery created at each point. Only used when Output Type is " at Each " or " Circle at Each ".

parameters.name: Radius Channel
parameters.label: Radius Channel
parameters.description: chanrad - Uniformly controls the radius of the geometry created at each point. The Radius channels are multiplied with the Radius parameter on the Output Page.

parameters.name: Radius Channel X
parameters.label: Radius Channel X
parameters.description: chanradx - Channels that control the radius on the respective axis. The Radius channels are multiplied with the Radius parameter on the Output Page.

parameters.name: Radius Channel Y
parameters.label: Radius Channel Y
parameters.description: chanrady - Channels that control the radius on the respective axis. The Radius channels are multiplied with the Radius parameter on the Output Page.

parameters.name: Radius Channel Z
parameters.label: Radius Channel Z
parameters.description: chanradz - Channels that control the radius on the respective axis. The Radius channels are multiplied with the Radius parameter on the Output Page.

parameters.name: Alpha Channel
parameters.label: Alpha Channel
parameters.description:
chanalpha - Controls the point alpha, giving you alpha control of any geometry created at those points.	
Note: If using a Copy SOP, turn on the Use Template   option in the Copy 's  Page to allow the geometry to inherit the point attributes.

parameters.name: Red Channel
parameters.label: Red Channel
parameters.description: chanr - These channels control the point color, or the color of any geometry created at those points.

parameters.name: Green Channel
parameters.label: Green Channel
parameters.description: chang - These channels control the point color, or the color of any geometry created at those points.

parameters.name: Blue Channel
parameters.label: Blue Channel
parameters.description: chanb - These channels control the point color, or the color of any geometry created at those points.

parameters.name: Texture W
parameters.label: Texture W
parameters.description: texturew - Controls the w texture-offset for the point(s) This is most often used as a frame-offset or time-offset, expressed in # of frames from the current frame or frame 1 of an image sequence.

parameters.name: Custom Attribute
parameters.label: Custom Attribute
parameters.description:
customattr - Sequence of custom attributes to be added to the geometry created.



  customattr0name - Specify the name of the custom attribute, for example pscale, age, or any custom name.



  customattr0chan0 - Select which channel to assign to the [0] index of the attribute. ie. pscale[0]



  customattr0chan1 - Select which channel to assign to the [1] index of the attribute. ie. pscale[1]



  customattr0chan2 - Select which channel to assign to the [2] index of the attribute. ie. pscale[2]



  customattr0chan3 - Select which channel to assign to the [3] index of the attribute. ie. pscale[3]

parameters.name: Name
parameters.label: Name
parameters.description: customattr0name - Specify the name of the custom attribute, for example pscale, age, or any custom name.

parameters.name: Channel Zero
parameters.label: Channel Zero
parameters.description: customattr0chan0 - Select which channel to assign to the [0] index of the attribute. ie. pscale[0]

parameters.name: Channel One
parameters.label: Channel One
parameters.description: customattr0chan1 - Select which channel to assign to the [1] index of the attribute. ie. pscale[1]

parameters.name: Channel Two
parameters.label: Channel Two
parameters.description: customattr0chan2 - Select which channel to assign to the [2] index of the attribute. ie. pscale[2]

parameters.name: Channel Three
parameters.label: Channel Three
parameters.description: customattr0chan3 - Select which channel to assign to the [3] index of the attribute. ie. pscale[3]

parameters.name: Output Type
parameters.label: Output Type
parameters.description:
output -  - The type of geometry the Limit  produces from its sample data.

 line - Creates a point for each sample and connects them with a polygonal line. polys - Places a polygon at each sample point. Number of points in polygon defined by Divisions. circles - Places a primitive circle at each sample point. spheres - Places a primitive sphere at each smaple point. polyspheres - Places a polygonal sphere at each sample point. Sphere's frequency defined by Divisions. tubes - Creates a tube down the path. Tubes cross-section defined by Divisions. strips - Creates a strip down the path. Number of points in strip defined by Divisions.

parameters.name: Polygonal Line
parameters.label: Polygonal Line
parameters.description: line - Creates a point for each sample and connects them with a polygonal line. polys - Places a polygon at each sample point. Number of points in polygon defined by Divisions. circles - Places a primitive circle at each sample point. spheres - Places a primitive sphere at each smaple point. polyspheres - Places a polygonal sphere at each sample point. Sphere's frequency defined by Divisions. tubes - Creates a tube down the path. Tubes cross-section defined by Divisions. strips - Creates a strip down the path. Number of points in strip defined by Divisions.

parameters.name: Divisions
parameters.label: Divisions
parameters.description:
divisions - Only works on the following Output Types.	
 at Each  - Number of points per polygon.
Poly Sphere at Each  - Frequency of each Polygonal Sphere.
Tubes - Number of points in cross-section of the tube.
Strips - Number of points in cross-section of the strip.

parameters.name: Radius
parameters.label: Radius
parameters.description: rad - Radius of geometry created. Disabled for "Polygonal Line".

parameters.name: Smooth Flip
parameters.label: Smooth Flip
parameters.description: flipsmooth - Dynamically controls the twist of each instance of geometry on a series of points to avoid frame-by-frame flipping, which can sometimes occur when geometry is oriented along a path.

parameters.name: Limit
parameters.label: Limit
parameters.description:
dolimit -  - Creates a bounding box for the position of the output geometry. Drop down menu determines behavior when outside bounded region.

 off - Bounding region off. clamp - Clamps position to specified value. loop - Loops position between bounded region. zigzag - Zigzags position back and forth between bounded region.

parameters.name: Off
parameters.label: Off
parameters.description: off - Bounding region off. clamp - Clamps position to specified value. loop - Loops position between bounded region. zigzag - Zigzags position back and forth between bounded region.

parameters.name: X Limit
parameters.label: X Limit
parameters.description:
xlimit -  - Parameters to set edges of bounding region when Limit is active.

xlimitmin -xlimitmax -

parameters.name: Y Limit
parameters.label: Y Limit
parameters.description:
ylimit -  - Parameters to set edges of bounding region when Limit is active.

ylimitmin -ylimitmax -

parameters.name: Z Limit
parameters.label: Z Limit
parameters.description:
zlimit -  - Parameters to set edges of bounding region when Limit is active.

zlimitmin -zlimitmax -

parameters.name: Apply Texture
parameters.label: Apply Texture
parameters.description: texture - Applys u, v, and w texture coordinates to the created geometry.

parameters.name: Scale
parameters.label: Scale
parameters.description:
texscale -  - Scales the texture coordinates a specific amount.

texscale1 -texscale2 -

parameters.name: Offset
parameters.label: Offset
parameters.description:
texoffset -  - Offsets the texture coordinates a specific amount.

texoffset1 -texoffset2 -

parameters.name: Orient to Path
parameters.label: Orient to Path
parameters.description: orient - If this option is selected, the object will be oriented along the path. To see what the path looks like, change the Output Type to "Polygonal Line". When the Output Type is "/ Circle at Each ", the positive Z axis of each object will be pointing down the path. When the Output Type is "Tubes/Strips" then the cross-section of the geometry created will be pointing down the path.

parameters.name: Lookat Object
parameters.label: Lookat Object
parameters.description: lookat - Orient to  must be checked for Lookat Object to have any effect. This allows you to orient your geometry by naming the object you would like it to Look At, or point to. Once you have designated this object to look at, it will continue to face that object, even if you move it. The Look At parameter points the each piece of geometry at the other object's origin individually.

parameters.name: Rotate Polys
parameters.label: Rotate Polys
parameters.description:
dorotate -  - Rotate the geometry at each point using the Rotate parameter (below). Only works for Output Type is "/ Circle at Each ".

 off - Do not rotate polys. Rotate parameter is greyed out. on - Add value of Rotate to polys equally. cum - Add value of Rotate to polys cumulatively (ie. increasing with each poly).

parameters.name: Off
parameters.label: Off
parameters.description: off - Do not rotate polys. Rotate parameter is greyed out. on - Add value of Rotate to polys equally. cum - Add value of Rotate to polys cumulatively (ie. increasing with each poly).

parameters.name: Rotate
parameters.label: Rotate
parameters.description:
rotate -  - Rotation channels rx, ry, and rz for Rotate Polys parameter.

 rotatex - rotatey - rotatez -

parameters.name: X
parameters.label: X
parameters.description: rotatex - rotatey - rotatez -

parameters.name: Compute Normals
parameters.label: Compute Normals
parameters.description: normals - Computes normals for the geometry created.
